newsitem.title: MALAYSIA: Ringgit's weakens as dollar finds support.
newsitem.headline: Ringgit's weakens as dollar finds support.

text.p: The ringgit weakened late into the session after attempts at climbing to a year's high was met by dollar buying from Malaysian banks, dealers said.
Carrying over from its overnight strength, the ringgit nevertheless failed to breach 2.4700 a dollar after buying of the U.S. currency by big banks.
"Two large Kuala Lumpur banks were seen purchasing the dollar/ringgit, prompting speculation that Bank Negara was in, supporting the spot," said research house MMS International.
Other dealers suggested the dollar-buying was from importers.
In late Tuesday trading, dollar/ringgit had broken support at 2.4750 and threatens to fall to its year low of 2.4660 a dollar, dealers said.
They said mixed corporate demand for ringgit and worries of central bank intervention should provide some relief for the dollar in the immediate term.
At the 1000 GMT Kuala Lumpur close, ringgit was at 2.4750/60 a dollar against 2.4748/58 at its Tuesday local closing.
